The Red Hat Enterprise Experience and Delivery Software Production (EXD SP) Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Distribution team is looking for a highly motivated individual who wants to gain practical experience with open source and Red Hat products during a summer internship to join us as a Software Engineering intern. In this role, you will work in an environment where diverse perspectives are invited, the best ideas are valued, and people feel empowered to contribute. Freedom and courage are two of our core values, which is why youll need to be comfortable taking risks and exploring the unknown. But being a Red Hatter isn't just about being brave, it's also about demonstrating commitment and sticking to it.

The key focus for Red Hat's Intern Program is a dual partnership between the early talent team and our intern managers. We can offer you professional development, social engagement and networking, performance and development, and meaningful work throughout your summer at Red Hat.

Primary job responsibilities
  • Develop and maintain software using modern agile software development practices
  • Improve the tools and processes used to deliver Red Hat solutions to customers
  • Use sound unit test methodologies to ensure these tools are robust, reliable, and ready for the next generation of open source technologies
  • Work in an hybrid cloud environment where your software interacts with bare metal platforms as well as virtualized platforms like OpenStack and OpenShift
  • Help the team adopt continuous integration (CI) and continuous development (CD) methodologies
  • Collaborate with users of our tools and other stakeholders to find solutions to their problems
  • Collaborate with upstream open source communities on relevant projects
  • Participate in delivering content to Red Hat customers
Required skills
  • Ability to work full-time May-August
  • Currently pursuing a degree in computer science or engineering, or a related field; if you have graduated, be no more than 6 months past your graduation date
  • Knowledge of the UNIX or Linux operating system in any distribution
  • Coding experience in languages like Python
  • Good written and verbal communication skills

The following are considered a plus:

  • Previous code contributions to or participation in open source projects or code samples on GitHub
  • Knowledge of Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform, Jenkins, Bash scripting, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Kubernetes, or Red Hat Openshift Container Platform
  • Knowledge or experience with Golang

About Red Hat

Red Hat is the worlds leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.

position: Systems Engineer Intern, DRIVE AV - Summer 2021
description:
NVIDIAs invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI the next era of computing with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world! Today, we are increasingly known as the AI computing company. Are you willing to challenge yourself, and build great software by working with the smartest people in the world? Join us at the forefront of technological advancement.

What you'll be doing:

  • Responsible for the technical relationship and assisting the automotive customer in building creative solutions based on Nvidia technology.

  • Responsible for integrating different hardware and software components optimally for customer products.

  • Provide technical support, bring up customer hardware, debug and resolve system issues.

  • Performing in-vehicle tests, capturing & analyzing data and completing autonomous drive missions.

  • Collaborate with engineering teams in our US, APAC, India and Europe locations.

What we need to see:

  • A general understanding of the main SW technologies used in ADAS and self-driving cars (computer vision, deep learning, path planning, etc.)

  • Experience in the development of embedded systems, including formulating system level requirements, designs and architectures.

  • Customer facing skill-set and background working with developers, researchers, start-ups and established technical/industry partners.

  • Strong knowledge of scripting and Python

  • Excellent C and C++ programming skills

  • Experienced Linux user

  • Pursing BS/MS/PhD degree in computer science, electrical engineering, related technical field, or equivalent experience

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with good attention to details.

  • Experience working with self-driving cars or other real-time robotics/mechatronics systems.

  • Experience with automotive design processes and norms

  • Excellent communication and organization skills, good time management and task prioritization.

  • Dedicated and able to work with minimum supervision.

  • Experience with GPGPU programming (CUDA and OpenCL)

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Job Description

We are seeking a software engineering intern to work as a contributing member of an advanced software development team. As an intern, you will work with the team's lead software engineers on projects that are closely aligned with our product milestones.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Participating in formal design and implementation activities.
  • Developing requirements, code and unit and other automated testing solutions.
  • Providing engineering management with accurate effort estimates for projected work.
  • Effectively collaborating with technical leaders in a multi-team environment.
  • Demonstrating flexibility and resilience in the face of changing priorities and requirements.

Qualifications:

  • Experience with the Java programming language.
  • Understanding of object oriented coding and design principles.
  • Knowledge of software engineering concepts related to the implementation and deployment of distributed microservices, such as REST API theory of operation, messaging (e.g. Azure Event Hubs), and data storage/retrieval (e.g. in-memory cache, database).
  • Able to troubleshoot and debug issues.
Basic Requirements

Currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or related field with a graduation date on or after December 1st, 2021.

Travel Requirements None
Relocation Provided None
Position Type Intern
Referral Payment Plan No

EEO Statement

Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

The Solution Design Studio Intern will gain professional work exposure by collaborating with designers and other stakeholders across a diverse set of teams to apply User Experience expertise in real-world situations. Projects will be fast-paced and cover a variety of user-centered responsibilities including user experience research and user experience design. The individual will gain experience visualizing and validating product requirements with the use of user personas, user scenarios, process flows, wireframes, and interactive simulations. In addition to these areas of focus the intern will also gain exposure to emerging technologies and their potential impact on healthcare and life sciences through projects the studio is engaged in. This job is for a fixed duration not to exceed 12 months, with no guarantee to subsequent employment with the company.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Shadows and learns functions and/or projects under the close supervision of a designer/analyst in the Studio.
  • Deploys user-centered design practices on projects in the user research and user experience realm of the design process.
  • Embraces an agile and iterative approach to projects, ranging from presentations to interfaces.
  • Enhances professional and industry knowledge by building upon current academic experience. This position offers a professional work environment experience in an open studio setting, two-way communication tactics, and exposure to the IQVIA organizational structure.
  • Engages with the team and asks questions to help identify their own personal interests and ambitions related to the job.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  • Appropriate verbal and written communication skills to function within a professional work environment.
  • Proficiency in using design thinking methods to accomplish project goals.
  • Evidence of strong visual communication skills through work samples.
  • Working knowledge with UI and UX prototyping tools (Sketch, Justinmind, FramerX are a plus but not required).

MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Pursuing Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction & Human Factors, Graphic Design or closely related subject
  • Preferably a rising junior or senior, but will consider other class levels

At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. At Oshkosh, we build, serve and protect people and communities around the world by designing and manufacturing some of the toughest specialty trucks and access equipment. We employ over 15,000 team members all united by a common purpose. Our engineering and product innovation help keep soldiers and firefighters safe, is critical in building and keeping communities clean and helps people do their jobs every day.

escription

COMPANY PROFILE Oshkosh Corporation is a leading manufacturer and marketer of access equipment, specialty vehicles and truck bodies for the primary markets of defense, concrete placement, refuse hauling, access equipment and fire & emergency. Founded in 1917, Oshkosh Corporation has manufacturing operations in nine U.S. states and in Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, China, France, Mexico, The Netherlands, and Romania. The company currently employs approximately 12,100 people worldwide. Oshkosh Corporation is a Fortune 500, multi-billion dollar company. Oshkosh Corporation designs and builds the world's toughest specialty trucks, truck bodies, and access equipment by working shoulder-to-shoulder with the people who use them. POSITION SUMMARY As a member in data analytics team for Corporate Engineering, this individual will work within advanced engineering groups and a cross-functional team to develop and execute the data analytics strategy and apply it to Oshkosh products. Data analytics work encompasses the acquisition, processing and machine learning of engineering or service data and application to preventive maintenance and intelligence control of on or off-road vehicles. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPSONSIBILITIES
  • Apply and assign data science tools used by Oshkosh Corporation team members including, but not limited to telematics and engineering data analysis, warranty data or service data analysis and text mining of textual records from different functions in the corporation
  • Work with other team members in Oshkosh to establish and execute the data analytics strategy regarding telematics, cloud hosting, data file system, and preprocessing and engineering applications
  • Understand the technical aspects of advanced diagnostics and prognostics and support the validation and verification of the intelligent preventive maintenance strategy using statistics and machine learning techniques.
  • Conduct research under supervision on new technologies in cloud-based data analytics and establish requirements (resources, equipment, estimates, test plans, and milestones) and roadmap according to the needs of a project.
  • Conduct data processing and data analytics on Hadoop Distributed File Systems (HDFS) for different vehicle platforms
  • Collaborate with other team members to manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality data in cloud or on-premise from various sources to highlight patterns, anomalies, relationships and trends with machine learning techniques using modeling tools (such as Anaconda Python or alike).
  • Work with service or engineering design teams to provide insight based on data analytics results on maintenance enhancement and product design improvement.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Graduate degree student majoring in Data Science, Computer Sciences, Engineering, Statistics, or related field.
  • Knowledge of Python or data analytics tools.
  • Strongly motivated in learning new technologies and skills in the data analytics fields
  • Have a good understanding about the business side of analytics projects.
  • Excellent time management, communication and presentation skills.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above
  • Automotive or heavy duty on or off-road vehicle, digital data bus, including Ethernet or Controller Area Network (CAN) experiences
  • Course project knowledge of data file systems (Hadoop) and data processing techniques (Kafka, Impala, or Map Reduce, etc.), data modeling and data virtualization tools.

position: Software Engineering Internship - Site Reliability Engineering Services
description:
Red Hat is the worlds leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. We strive to make software freely accessible to everyone around the world. Software developed at Red Hat runs in vehicles that landed on the moon, airlines, banks, trains, social media, health care, academic institutions, robots, and in many other places.

If youre interested, keep reading!

The Red Hat Site Reliability Engineering Services team is looking for a highly motivated Software Engineering Intern who wants to gain direct experience with open source and Red Hat offerings during a summer internship to join us. In this role, you will work in an environment where diverse perspectives are invited, the best ideas are valued, and people feel empowered to contribute. Freedom and courage are two of our core values, which is why youll need to be comfortable taking risks and exploring the unknown. But being a Red Hatter isn't just about being brave, it's also about demonstrating commitment and sticking to it.

The key focus of Red Hat's Intern Program is a dual partnership between the early talent team and our intern managers. We can offer you professional development, social engagement and networking, performance and development, and meaningful work throughout your summer at Red Hat. Successful applicants must reside in a state where Red Hat is registered to do business.

Primary job responsibilities
  • Learn the fundamentals of the discipline of site reliability engineering (SRE); this includes how to organize both software components and human teams to provide massively parallelized on-line sites and services in a reliable, operationally consistent, and computationally efficient manner
  • Learn and understand Red Hats existing tools and infrastructure that assist us in our SRE quest
  • Contribute to coding new features, fixes, and improvements to infrastructure that automates the building, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance of Red Hats online services
  • Participate in a geographically-distributed agile team that evaluates and scopes competing feature proposals and distributes tasks to team members
Required skills
  • Ability to work full-time May-August
  • Currently pursuing a degree in engineering, computer science, or a related field; if you have graduated, be no more than 6 months past your graduation date
  • Some knowledge of the UNIX or Linux operating system (any distribution)
  • Some familiarity with containerisation, e.g., Docker, and container orchestration platforms, e.g., Red Hat OpenShift or Kubernetes
  • Coding experience in languages like Python, JavaScript, or Bash shell
  • Passion for technology and for solving complex problems; ability to create or identify solutions that are well-tested and maintainable
  • Curiosity about open source practices and the open source ethos that supports them
  • Ability to work well on your own and in groups; experience with and an appreciation for agile principles and practices
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to collaborate in a globally distributed environment
  • Previous code contributions to or participation in open source projects or code samples on GitHub are a plus

#LI-REMOTE

About Red Hat

Red Hat is the worlds leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.

Job description

The Solution Design Studio Intern will gain professional work exposure by collaborating with designers and other stakeholders across a diverse set of teams to apply User Experience expertise in real-world situations. Projects will be fast-paced and cover a variety of user-centered responsibilities including user experience research and user experience design. The individual will gain experience visualizing and validating product requirements with the use of user personas, user scenarios, process flows, wireframes, and interactive simulations. In addition to these areas of focus the intern will also gain exposure to emerging technologies and their potential impact on healthcare and life sciences through projects the studio is engaged in. This job is for a fixed duration not to exceed 12 months, with no guarantee to subsequent employment with the company.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Shadows and learns functions and/or projects under the close supervision of a designer/analyst in the Studio.
  • Deploys user-centered design practices on projects in the user research and user experience realm of the design process.
  • Embraces an agile and iterative approach to projects, ranging from presentations to interfaces.
  • Enhances professional and industry knowledge by building upon current academic experience. This position offers a professional work environment experience in an open studio setting, two-way communication tactics, and exposure to the IQVIA organizational structure.
  • Engages with the team and asks questions to help identify their own personal interests and ambitions related to the job.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  • Appropriate verbal and written communication skills to function within a professional work environment.
  • Proficiency in using design thinking methods to accomplish project goals.
  • Evidence of strong visual communication skills through work samples.
  • Working knowledge with UI and UX prototyping tools (Sketch, Justinmind, FramerX are a plus but not required).

MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Pursuing Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction & Human Factors, Graphic Design or closely related subject
  • Preferably a rising junior or senior, but will consider other class levels

IT Operations Summer Internship

Duration: June 7 - August 20, 2021

Internship will be almost entirely remote, but intern may be required to attend meetings or events on site in St. Petersburg, FL

If selected, interviewing starts January 4, 2021

Infrastructure & Operations is the PSCU IT department responsible for all technology infrastructure and its operations, as well as the operations and production support of all enterprise applications. The department is made up of two teams:

Infrastructure The infrastructure team is responsible for the technology used by the company daily to deliver services to our member credit unions. This technology includes voice and data networks, telephony, storage, servers, data centers, cloud, and end-user devices.

Operations the operations team is responsible for the support and operations of all production applications and their supporting infrastructures. This includes all levels of the tiered production support model, as well as support for application implementation, and tier 3 development.

I&O Internship

Goals and Objectives

The purpose of this engagement is for an I&O intern to help PSCU design, develop and implement a streamlined and efficient process and associated technical capabilities for running day to day IT Operations.

The intern will collaborate with teams across PSCU to:

  • Document current processes used to run day to day IT Operations
  • Processes include steps followed to address alerts, major and non-major incidents reported, working with other PSCU teams, external FI connect, capacity planning, performance analysis etc.
  • Access efficiency of detailed processes and find opportunities to improve.
  • Identify and assess how existing technology solutions such as Vitor Ops, SPLUNK, Service Now, Solarwinds etc. that could be used to improve the process and overall availability
  • Detail the desired end-state and the process improvements and solutions needed to reach that detailed and documented state.

Our Program

When selecting a company for your career are you someone that values bettering communities and the people that live in those communities? Are you looking for an organization that is leading in their industry and continues to grow and innovate based on client needs and industry trends? Does the idea of phenomenal team culture and a career that fits your life and goals exciting?

The PSCUs Summer Internship Program provides you a junior or senior undergraduate student - with the chance to develop and hone your skills in business. We offer the opportunity to build for your future by learning firsthand the Financial and more specifically Credit Union industry through business acumen training, coupled with focused learning opportunities in a core functional specialty. Youll also gain insight into our rich history, our unique culture, and our committed social conscience.

In this 10-week program, for the first week, youll engage in orientation and get a grounding in Credit Unions. For the remaining time, youll work in a specific core function in our St. Petersburg headquarters based on your interests and interview results. In addition to your daily work, youll be participating leadership development sessions and interacting with PSCUs senior leadership teams.

PSCU Intern Program Entry Qualifications

  • Completion of sophomore or junior year in an accredited undergraduate degree program with a 3.0/4.0 GPA at time of application.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to coordinate thoughts, communicate, completely, and concisely.
  • Strong, organizational, and detail skills, with the ability to consistently meet deadlines.
  • Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration skills.
  • Ability to pivot easily when directions and priorities change on short notice.
  • Proficiency in MS Office Suite with a heavy emphasis on Excel.
  • Proficiency in software that applies to your major and function-specific internship.
  • Passion for learning the Credit Union Industry.
  • Must be able to commute to St. Petersburg when vital during the program.
  • Being friendly, enthusiastic, and energetic, with a genuine desire to provide outstanding service.

I&O Internship Requirements

  • Competency with basic programming skills and IT infrastructure components, such as servers and operating systems.
  • An understanding of basic SDLC process
  • The following abilities and skills are highly desirable: data analysis, general business concepts, research and analysis, collaboration, curiosity, innovation.
  • General business knowledge, organizational behavior courses, and/or leadership involvement in extracurricular activities
  • Excel, Word and PowerPoint expertise
  • Knowledge of dashboarding solutions and/or ways to conceptualize sophisticated data in simple ways preferred.

Do you want to be part of a team that encourages your growth, supports your ambitions and makes it a priority for you to reach your goals? Is helping people part of who you are? At MassMutual, we help millions of people find financial freedom, offer financial protection and plan for the future. We do this by building trust with our customers by being knowledgeable problem solvers and prioritize their needs above all else. We Live Mutual.

Description

Haven Life is an insurtech innovator at MassMutual that offers a new way to get life insurance online that's actually simple.

We combine the culture of a startup with the stability and backing of a Fortune 100 company to create an environment that's truly unique.

Our diverse team is comprised of smart, collaborative people who think big, execute quickly and don't take themselves too seriously. We're located in New York's Flatiron District and in case you're wondering, yes, we provide free snacks. Cold brew too.

If you're creative, professional and kind, we'd love to hear from you.

ABOUT OUR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM:

You will be joining a small, experienced technology team responsible for our advanced online financial services application. As a contributing member of the team, you will have the opportunity to own and deliver a meaningful project throughout your internship. During this time, you will work closely with experienced software engineers, receiving mentorship and guidance, and contributing to both our complex platform as well as to our collaborative, inclusive culture. You'll get to work with cutting edge technologies such as Typescript, Node.js, Angular 6, Postgres and AWS.

Working with other developers in an agile environment, you might work on items such as:

  • Developing additions to as well as evolving how we currently underwrite our policies
  • Developing tools that will help us process large quantities of insurance applications from several different sources
  • Defining and applying rule sets for third party data feeds
  • Work on integrations with third party APIs and services
  • Contribute to and develop quality microservices
  • Contribute to the bread and butter of our organization: the apps! You can develop customer facing components on several different applications

Our work is varied and challenging, and you get to be an integral part of that. Our full-time summer internship program will last 10 weeks. Will begin in June 2021. You will be part of a small cohort of other interns. Join us for a summer full of learning, building and collaborating!

WHAT WE'D LOVE TO SEE FROM YOU:

  • Rising Senior or Master's student pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related field (Spring 2022 Grad)
  • Experience with traditional object oriented languages (e.g. Java, Javascript, C++)
  • Exposure to modern MVC (Model-view-controller) frameworks and front end frameworks such as Angular or React
  • Solid grounding in data driven applications and concepts (data/object modeling, database systems)
  • Enthusiasm about technology, new trends in the tech space, etc.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Comfortable expressing points of view while respecting those of others
  • Research / papers in CS
  • Participation in CS-related clubs, events, hackathons or side projects
  • Authorized to work in the US with or without sponsorship
  • Must be able to work full-time from our Manhattan office throughout the internship

Why Join Us.

We've been around since 1851. During our history, we've learned a few things about making sure our customers are our top priority. In order to meet and exceed their expectations, we must have the best people providing the best thinking, products and services. To accomplish this, we celebrate an inclusive, vibrant and diverse culture that encourages growth, openness and opportunities for everyone. A career with MassMutual means you will be part of a strong, stable and ethical business with industry leading pay and benefits. And your voice will always be heard.

Recognized as a 2019 World's Most Ethical Company by Ethisphere, MassMutual is guided by a single purpose: We help people secure their future and protect the ones they love. As a company owned by our policyowners, we are defined by mutuality and our vision to put customers first. It's more than our company structure it's our way of life. We are a company of people protecting people. Our company exists because people are willing to share risk and resources, and rely on each other when it counts. At MassMutual, we Live Mutual.
